thinking.disposable_income: Irving Park has a median household income of $86,849, with 43.1% of households earning over $100,000. However, 28.6% earn less than $50,000, indicating a mix of income levels that need consideration for transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: With a per capita income of $48,320, residents have moderate discretionary spending power. Higher sales taxes would impact consumption, especially for the 28.6% lower-income households
thinking.accessibility: 86.1% of households own at least one car, with driving alone (49.6%) being the primary commute mode. Transit usage is significant at 18.5%, suggesting good transit access. 13.9% of households have no vehicle and rely on alternative transportation
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized balanced policies that maintain transit affordability while improving service. 2. Considered the significant car ownership and driving population when evaluating driving fees. 3. Selected policies that minimize impact on lower-income residents while maintaining service quality. 4. Favored proposals with moderate tax increases to support transit without overly burdening discretionary spending. 5. Weighted travel time improvements against cost increases for both transit and driving users
